data.title: This Day in History
data.meta_description: Charged with attempted criminal assault on a white girl, Lint Shaw, a black farmer, was saved from a threatening mob by National Guardsmen. Guards take Shaw from Danielsville, Ga., jail on April 12, 1936, which a lynch mob stormed in effort to seize the prisoner. Shaw was rushed to Athens, Ga., for safe keeping. (AP)
data.text:
Charged with attempted criminal assault on a white girl, Lint Shaw, a black farmer, was saved from a threatening mob by National Guardsmen. Guards take Shaw from Danielsville, Ga., jail on April 12, 1936, which a lynch mob stormed in effort to seize the prisoner. Shaw was rushed to Athens, Ga., for safe keeping. (AP)

Sen. Joseph McCarthy, R-Wis., eats lunch at the Senate restaurant on April 12, 1951, after his return from Milwaukee. He told newsmen his statement President Harry Truman's firing of Gen. Douglas MacArthur "not only was a victory for communism but shows the midnight power of bourbon and Benedictine. (AP)

A question by a newsman brings a smile to the face of Dr. Jonas E. Salk in Ann Arbor, Mich., on April 12, 1955. Salk's polio vaccine was deemed successful in a report by Dr. Thomas Francis Jr. (right) read to a group of scientists and physicians at the University of Michigan. At center is Basil O'Connor, president of the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis. (AP/Preston Stroup)

Rev. Ralph Abernathy (left) and Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. (right) are taken by a policeman as they led a line of demonstrators into the business section of Birmingham, Ala., on April 12, 1963. (AP)

Norwegian civilians watch the entry of German troops, led by a band, into the Norwegian capital of Oslo on April 12, 1940. (AP)

An American flag flies at half staff on a building on Fifth Avenue in New York after news reports of the death President Franklin D. Roosevelt on April 12, 1945. At left is St. Patrick's Cathedral. (AP/Tom Fitzsimmons)

Eleanor Roosevelt (left) shakes hands with Winston Churchill, Britain's wartime prime minister, at the door of the latter's home in Hyde Park gate in London on April 12, 1948, after lunching with the Churchills. Mrs. Roosevelt unveiled Britain's memorial to her late husband, President Franklin D. Roosevelt on the third anniversary of his death. (AP)

President John Kennedy answers a question during his ninth presidential news conference in Washington on April 12, 1961. The conference dealt largely with space exploration and international affairs. (AP/RMB)

A crowd lines sidewalk in Da Nang, South Vietnam, on April 12, 1965, as they turn out to greet a U.S. Marine landing team. The Marines were landed at Da Nang Beach as part of a buildup for units guarding the air base at Da Nang. (AP)

Actress Elizabeth Taylor and actor husband Richard Burton link arms to share a drink on April 12, 1967, in Valescure, France. Both were nominated for Academy Awards for their performances in Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf? (AP)

Protesters face policemen during a demonstration in Berlin on April 12, 1968. The demonstration took place one day after Rudi Dutschke, the leader of a left-wing German student movement, was shot in the head and seriously wounded. (AP)

Accompanied by deputy U.S. Marshal John Brophy, Patty Hearst leaves the Federal building at San Francisco on April 12, 1976, hours after her sentencing on a bank robbery conviction. She faced additional charges at Los Angeles and is to undergo 90 days of psychiatric examination befor sentencing by U.S. District Judge Oliver J. Carter. (AP)

Actor Burt Reynolds is shown on the set with cast members of NBC's Saturday Night Live in New York on April 12, 1980. From left is Jane Curtin, Laraine Newman, Gilda Radner, Reynolds and Bill Murray. (AP/Suzanne Vlamis)

Sen. Edward M. Kennedy, campaigning in the warm California sunshine, tells reporters at a beach party picnic a new poll shows him leading President Jimmy Carter with 10 days to go before the presidential primaryon April 12, 1980, in Santa Monica, Calif. (AP/Reed Saxon)

Bernie Sanders, mayor of Burlington, Vt., told students at the University of Connecticut's West Hartford campus his tenure as a socialist mayor is evidence people are willing to accept radical change on April 12, 1983. (AP/Bob Child)

NW News on 04/12/2020
